messages.message: hi team, where can I find `instabase_backend_db_params` of aihub dogfood db? (aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com (http://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com))
I think you can look in the config of core-platform-service
are you trying to connect to the aihub-sandbox db from your local env? if so, i’m pretty sure that won’t work since we lock down all external access to our sandbox dbs
good to know! I just thought it would be easier to test if localhost is hook up to aihub dogfood db, but it’s no big deal if not possible
i would like this a lot as well :smiling_face_with_tear: maybe i’ll bother heymian or shaunak about this one day
The only way to get that is to request TPAM access and read it from the k8s secrets.
But our DBs are locked down as well :relaxed:

yep! for local dev testing, it would be helpful to access the same db as aihub-sandbox - for example, we could set up a project on aihub-sandbox to use for testing, instead of needing to run everything locally

obviously, this need could be eliminated if we all start using crafting sandboxes so that we don’t need to run everything locally
@Serena One thing we could do is periodically snapshot the sandboxes, and then I can publish the snapshot as sqlite files.
That way, you can use the latest snapshot with your local env
Are we switching to using sandboxes for frontend dev? I would've thought that too expensive
We setup crafting.dev to help with local development of sandboxes.  How is that going?

we’ve had various issues using crafting - the latest one i know of is https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1693000075892999?thread_ts=1692900381.921629&cid=C05L87V014J, and i haven’t checked on it since then

@sean.donohoe can you please work with @Serena on zoom / huddle to get all the hurdles sorted out of using crafting.dev?  It might be better to just hash it out over a huddle than going back and forth over slack.

That way we can move more developers over to it :slightly_smiling_face:
btw now is also not a good time for me to start using a new dev setup :sweat_smile: we’re in peak crunch time for the 23.37 deadline
:sweat_smile: fair enough.  Can we do it the week following it?
